alert.note: Alert for Macon (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Macon. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 845 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen so far, with additional accumulations as heavy rain continues from a batch of stationary thunderstorms. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Milstead, Shorter, Franklin, Liverpool, Hardaway, Cross Keys and Fort Davis.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
